document_data.name: Haerun Mhammaster
document_data.mainbody: '''Haerun Mhammaster''' (or "Haerund") was a historian and sage of [[Waterdeep]] in the midâ€“14{{th}} century [[DR]].
document_data.Abilities: His main field of expertise was in history and the culture of [[demihuman]]s, namely [[dwarves]], [[elves]], [[gnome]]s, and [[halfling]]s, including their art, music, legends, and folklore.  He was also knowledgeable in [[cryptography]] and the [[architecture]] and [[engineering]] of dungeons and subterranean constructions.
document_data.Description: Greatly aged, he was hunchbacked, shrunken, and wrinkled. He was said to be as dusty as his books.
document_data.Activities: Staying always within his library, Haerund didn't seek out clients. Instead, he had friends at the [[Elfsong Tavern]] close by who, if they found trustworthy folks in need of his aid, sent them to his door.
document_data.Home: He lived in a rowhouse on the [[Street of Bells]] in the [[Waterdeep/Castle Ward|Castle Ward]]. His rooms and library were musty and dusty, but contained many pieces of [[elf]]-made statuary.
document_data.Relations: [[Johanna Kherrispehril]] was his apprentice for a time some time prior to [[1368 DR]].
